medical_history.chief_complaint: Evaluation and treatment of complex behavioral disturbances including attempts to escape, assaults, and inappropriate touching of female staff members.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mr. A first developed motor symptoms at age 15, diagnosed with Huntington's disease at age 20. Psychiatric symptoms began notably at age 24 with marked personality changes including shyness and withdrawal. One year prior to admission, he developed auditory hallucinations and delusions, leading to emergency admission and subsequent nursing home placement. Over time, multiple inappropriate behaviors emerged, including sexual inappropriateness and violence when redirected.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of surgical hernia repair at age 6, mild asthma as a child, and recent negative HIV test. No known medication allergies.
medical_history.family_history: Family history includes Huntington’s disease in the father and three paternal aunts; the father developed motor symptoms in his late 30s and died at age 52. His sister developed Huntington’s disease in her early teens and died at 28. His other siblings are asymptomatic.
medical_history.social_history: Born prematurely and developed normally, worked in janitorial services before disease onset. Had lived at home with mother until one year prior to admission. Heterosexual, no long-term relationships, no children. No history of smoking, alcohol abuse, illicit drug use, or criminal activity.
